title: Add Grade Checker Tool

requirements.text: Add a Grade Checker section to the app where students can input their last grade (as a letter grade or percentage), the subject (e.g., Math, Reading, Science), and the specific topic they struggled with. On submission, display a personalized set of tips and improvement strategies tailored to the entered subject and grade level.

quotes: Make a grade checker like the person in the app puts his last grade in about the subject what topic and how you are going to help him.

acceptanceCriteria: A Grade Checker form is visible on the page with three input fields: Last Grade (letter or percentage), Subject (e.g., Math, Reading, Science, Social Studies), and Topic (free-text describing what they found difficult).
The form has a clearly labeled submit/check button.
After submission, a results card appears below the form displaying the entered grade, subject, and topic back to the student.
The results card includes at least 4‚Äì5 personalized improvement tips relevant to the entered subject (e.g., math tips for Math, reading tips for Reading, etc.).
If the grade is low (e.g., D or below 70%), the tips section is prefaced with an encouraging message like 'Don't give up ‚Äî here's how you can improve!'
If the grade is passing (e.g., C or 70‚Äì84%), tips focus on going from good to great.
If the grade is high (e.g., A/B or 85%+), tips celebrate the student and suggest ways to stay on top.
The Grade Checker section matches the bright, warm, and playful visual theme of the rest of the app (rounded cards, cheerful colors, emoji accents).
The Grade Checker section is accessible via the existing Table of Contents navigation bar.

requirements.text: Add 'Grade Checker' as a ninth entry in the existing TableOfContents navigation bar so students can click it to jump directly to the Grade Checker section.

quotes: Make a grade checker like the person in the app puts his last grade in about the subject what topic and how you are going to help him.

acceptanceCriteria: The TableOfContents component includes a 'Grade Checker üìù' link after the 8 existing section links.
Clicking the link smoothly scrolls the user to the Grade Checker section.
The active-section highlight logic works for the Grade Checker section the same way it does for the 8 guide sections.

constraints: Do not modify any files under frontend/src/hooks/ (immutable paths).
Do not modify files under frontend/src/components/ui (immutable path).
The grade checker logic (tip generation based on subject and grade) should be implemented entirely on the frontend ‚Äî no backend changes required.
Visual theme must remain consistent with the existing warm, cheerful, 5th-grade-friendly design.
nonGoals: Persisting grade checker inputs or results to the backend.
User accounts or grade history tracking.
Integration with any external grading or school management systems.
Changing any of the 8 existing guide sections or their content.
